name: Grand Hotel Royal

reviews.title: romantic grand royal
reviews.text: we went to sorrento this year to get married and stayed at the grand royal hotel. it is a very beautiful and romantic hotel overlooking the sea.the staff are very friendly and it does cater very well for families with small and older children whilst being still romantic.the food is excellent we couldnt fault it and our son who is seven really enjoyd it too,he had the same menu as ourselves, often there was too much food to eat!!! they were extremely helpful when we got married and when we came back to have dinner with our guests after the ceremony they decorated a table for us and really made it even more special.we are going to go back there for our first annversary.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: what we liked was the privacy,the hotel has its own private bathing terraces down by the sea and its own private terrace and pool and is right on the front, so you can watch the boats coming and going.
reviews.title: Great View of Bay of Naples

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: very highly recommended.,and the town of sorrento is lovely too,shops are great!!!
reviews.title: Such a wonderful hotel!

likes.liked: — The dedication, professionalism and friendliness of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We have just returned from a week in the Grand Hotel Royal, Sorrento.
reviews.title: Good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: This is a traditional hotel furnished in a classic style; much of furniture using inlaid wood, and much of the flooring using painted tiles. The hotel is run by a friendly and efficient staff who provide good service.
reviews.title: Absolutely Beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for part of our trip to Italy to celebrate our 1 year anniversary. This hotel is a very short walk from the train station past the park and a short walk to Piazza Tasso the main square, but secluded enough from passers by and too many tourists. Check in was seamless. When we were showed to our room and looked off the balcony our jaws dropped. What a beautiful property and a great view! Our room was equpped with a large tv, mini-fridge, hairdryer, and 2 safes. The hotel is pretty pricey and that could be why we were probably the youngest couple there. There were a lot of 60+ people. The breakfast had a lot to choose from; Omletts, hot food, ham, yogurt, cereal, fruit, breads, etc. We only ate lunch at the property and it was pretty good. The drinks were a bit expensive and small for the price. The pool was nice, but too cold to stay in for an extened period of time.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel with great view

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The pool was great. Location is reasonably close to town.
reviews.title: Great breakfast, nice to our kids, not a business hotel.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Has no health club or "business center", so western travelers should beware of this. However, the staff was very nice and allowed me to email them a document, which they printed for us for free.
reviews.title: GET A SEA VIEW ROOM
Good Location
reviews.text: Great breakfast. People were nice to our 2 and 5 year olds.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Costs 20 Euro per day to park your car--and no safe street parking available, so factor this in.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012
reviews.text: Splendid hotel, setting, features but food and service do not live up to standard. Our room outlook was not very pleasant either.
reviews.title: Poor food andservice let this hotel down.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I stayed at this hotel last July for two weeks and I have only just got round to writing a review. It is a fabulous hotel - wonderful location, lovely rooms (don't worry about the noise from the road side rooms unless you leave your window open), and excellent food. But the main thing that has made us book again is the staff - fantastic - couldn't do enough to ensure you enjoyed your stay - and I have to single out the restaurant staff especially. When I didn't like the risotto, there was major concern! There wasn't anything wrong with the risotto - I just don't like it but thought I would try it on my first time to Italy! Due to the deserved popularity of this hotel, we have only managed to get a week in July, but are so looking forward to returning. Especially looking forward to meeting Antonino, Bruno and of course Franco again!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: My wife and I just returned from a vacation on the Amalfi Coast. Our trip started in Sorrento and we stayed at the Grand Hotel Royal. This is a five star Hotel posing as a four star. Everything about the Hotel was outstanding. The rooms were spotlessly clean and our balcony overlooked the Bay and the beautiful grounds. The staff at every level could not be more helpful. This was our first trip to this part of Italy and we had many questions. They were very gracious,and patient, and helped us with all our needs in Sorrento. The food in all the Hotel's restaurants was excellent, but I would be remiss if I did not comment especially about the breakfast. It was simply the best assortment of breakfast treats my wife and I have ever enjoyed. Vacations are supposed to be memorable and a Hotel like the Grand Royal works very hard to achieve that goal. It was an outstanding experience which we hope to enjoy again, and recommend highly to all our friends.
reviews.title: A perfect Holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Marlene and Bill Laraia
reviews.title: A grand hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my fourth holiday to Sorrento but my first at the Royal Hotel and it certainly won't be my last! This is an excellent four star hotel, which deserves to be five star. The location above the Marina is excellent and so close to the town centre. The views from the terrace across to Vesuvius are superb. All the staff are very friendly and helpful and even acknowledge you if they happen to pass you in the street. The food in the restaurant was good and varied, although the hot food at breakfast was not always as hot as one would like. The rooms are a very good size and well furnished. We had a room overlooking the main road, but had no problem at all with noise.
reviews.title: Come back to Sorrento and the Grand Royal time and time again!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned home from our 7th stay at the Grand Hotel Royal and, as usual, we had a fabulous time.
reviews.title: Another Fabulous Stay

likes.liked: — We love everything about the Royal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The professional and friendly staff are simply "THE BEST" and always make us feel at home...from the minute we book our room to the very last goodbyes.
reviews.title: If you come to Sorrento, stay at this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007
reviews.text: The Royal has a wonderful old-fashioned ambience combined with all the modern amenities one could wish. Each time we return they have added another touch to make it even more special.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room is light and bright and the view of the sea is magnificent! The breakfast buffet is varied and abundant.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

likes.disliked: — It felt as if it was in need of a major refurbishment within the next 2/3 years

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location is perfect...overlooking the sea and yet just a short walk from the center of town...Piazza Tasso.
reviews.title: Nice hotel but noisy!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We just love this hotel. April 2012 was our fourth visit to Sorrento, which is a walkable contained small city. Location of a hotel is important to us, especially for a eight-night stay. This is our second stay at the Grand Royal and it was just as satisfying as in 2009. It's a quick walk from the hotel through Parco Lauro to Corso Italia - take a left on Corso Italia and you are in Piazza Tasso within 4-5 minutes.
reviews.title: (Manniello) Grand Royal Hotel Just as Good as the First Time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our room was very clean as well as the bathroom, bed linens were changed frequently, plus the room was quiet so we were able to sleep well and wake up rested in the a.m. The breakfast room is gorgeous and the food selection on the many tables is one of the best we ever experienced.
reviews.title: Simply Brilliant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: As far as the front desk staff (including the hotel manager) and the rest of the hotel staff, they are/were professional, attentive to all our requests, all the while a pleasant demeanor. We were a part of four adults, and it was such a pleasant end to our day to have a night cap at the hotel bar. The bartender, Gennaro is a special person. He was the "icing on the cake" at the end of every busy day for four American tourists!
reviews.title: Single Rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The grounds of the Grand Royal are splendid! The gardens are well-kept and colorful, the pool is huge, wisteria vines cover lattice work that shades a sunny area. The interior is furnished with lovely overstuffed furniture without having a formal affect - it's really quite cozy in the parlors.
reviews.title: OK

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What's not to like? We will certainly book at the Grand Royal Hotel again.
reviews.title: When can I come back a third time??

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only good thing about this hotel was the staff and they were always polite and friendly. But the main problem with the hotel is that unless you pay for a sea view, your room will overlook a very, very busy main road....and 'very busy' is probably an understatement as it actually sounded like a race track at night. The sound of mopeds bombing up and down and people shouting most of the night made our stay miserable...due to the severe lack of sleep we were getting. Unfortunately, when you book either through a travel agent or the hotel directly, no one is going to be honest enough to tell you of this major disadvantage. So, unfortunately, we definitely wont be going back to this hotel or Sorrento either.
reviews.title: Terrible

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms in this hotel are spacious and gorgeous, the views of the Bay of Naples are absolutely spectacular. The room furnishings are especially beatiful, all with matching inlaid wood for which the region is known. The seaward rooms have good-sized balconies that hold a bistro table and two chairs, perfect for enjoying a glass of wine and perhaps some cheese (purchased in town) after a day of touring and before dinner. The location is great, just a few minutes walk from the center of Sorrento and just down the hill from the train terminal (head straight for the bay and you will run smack into the hotel), no taxi required. Meals are more geared toward tour groups rather than individuals, but the breakfast is quite nice with a selection that can fortify you for a day of touring - the fresh fruit was particularly good. The staff is very helpful and friendly, especially Mario who once he learned my wife needed to eat gluten-free had special GF treats ready for her each morning. The grounds are lovely and the pool is large, the hotel is expensive but if you can afford it you probably will not be disappointed. The only drawback is that without the balcony door open, it got quite stuffy in the room - maybe because we were there in the spring the AC wasn't on yet? The weather was so nice this was not a big enough issue to ask for expanation or rectification (but did prevent a 5 star rating, and yes we knew that opening the door cut off the heat/AC) but it could be an issue in hot weather (I'm speculating). Room safes did not cost us extra as some have written, we just needeed to get the key for the safe from the desk (we had a seaview deluxe room). Not that you are likely to spend much time watching TV, but there was a better than average selection of channels for Americans in Europe.
reviews.title: Great location, beautiful rooms

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: Grand, big rooms, elegant old world feel, modern conveniences, fantastic views, great grounds and pool, but also elevator ride down to private Mediterranean access and lounge chairs, ferry close. And lastly: Great buffet breakfast. Very relaxing. Good coffee. I am ready to go back right now!
reviews.title: I loved this place. It really is Grand and the staff is very nice too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: My mother,my husband and my self have just returned from a most enjoyable 11 night stay at the Grand Hotel Royal. We have stayed in Sorrento on 4 previous occasions and were aware of the hotel type and the itinerary. I would describe this hotel as an 'old world' type hotel typical of that found in Sorrento. We stayed on the second floor and the sea view (prepaid on booking) was spectacular. However, there is a considered noise from the ferries at the harbour,not an issue for us but would not suit travellers looking for exclusive peace and tranquility.That being said the outside ambience of the hotel was extremely quiet - no screaming children, infact no children at all - BLISS! The room was spacious and clean with standard minibar (expensive) and safe ( 38 euro charge for stay).There was an automatic shutter which ensured any light and noise was excluded from the room at night.
reviews.title: A wonderful holiday in Sorrento

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food at breakfast and evening meal was excellent and the service outstanding and the eating area was always emaculately presented .The cordiality ( without infringement) delivered by ALL the staff really made and enhanced our stay, special thanks to Giacomo,Antonio,Franco and Mario for their congeniality.
reviews.title: Wow, wow, wow
A gem
reviews.text: This has to be among the most pleasant and beautiful hotels in Sorrento -- my wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. The Royal's location is stunning, perched on a cliff above the Bay of Naples (and an elevator down to its own private "beach" access.) Some of the best memories from our holiday are of sipping aperitifs and watching the sun set on the veranda overlooking the palm-lined, landscaped garden. The Royal is classy but not over the top -- more of an casual, understated elegance. The service was always excellent, the staff friendly and very attentive. We'll definitely be back.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2005
reviews.text: We've stayed at the Royal twice now. Once in 2003 and again in 2005. We were half board both times.
reviews.title: Charming but they've made cutbacks
Entrance sign says 4 stars, but really it is a 3 star hotel
reviews.text: Our first stay was faultless. At the evening meal there was a varied salad buffet every evening. Once a week there was a fabulous and varied outdoor buffet on the terrace overlooking the Bay of Naples.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: However on our second stay it was obvious that there were cutbacks. The salad buffet was greatly reduced with the same choice every night ,which became monotonous. The once a week outdoor buffet was no longer available and had been replaced by an indoor "gala buffet" with limited choice and of a lesser standard.
reviews.title: Very good hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Apart from that everything was the same high standard. The staff were friendly, the room was clean. On both occasions we stayed in the same room, overlooking the road not the pool, yet we didn't find it that noisy.
reviews.title: Fantastic second year running!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It was very easy to find, just a few steps away from the train station. Friendly staff. Average room. Beautiful veiw from balcony. Very nice breakfast. Good location, colse to city center.
reviews.title: Nice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall a great stay in sorrento.
reviews.title: Very nice, enjoyed our stay

likes.disliked: — 20 euro per night to park the car - rip off!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Following a stay at a rather strange 4 star hotel in Rome, we made our way down to Sorrento and to the Grand Hotel Royal - this was booked independently by myself following reviews on Tripadvisor.
reviews.title: Not quite for Royalty but fine for Lords & Ladies...
50th Wedding Anniversary
reviews.text: We were very pleased with this hotel, it was clean, nicely decorated and generally had a pleasant feel to it. Staff were friendly and exceptionally helpful and breakfast was certainly plentiful. It was near buses and trains and the town of Sorrento has a lovely easy going atmosphere to it (at a cost) - be prepared to pay cover charges (3 euro) to sit at local cafes and very high prices for a drink.....anything up to 7 euros for one small beer!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: With that in mind - we're in Europe after all - we can certainly recommend this hotel. However, having paid 200 euro per night for our three night stay, it would have been nice to think car parking might have been included in that price, alas this was not to be and although the hotel has a garage, car parking cost us a further 20 euro per night.....
reviews.title: Terrific Location
Wonderful location
reviews.text: Enjoyed our two night stay at the Royal. A BEAUTIFUL place with a perfect location. Sitting out on the courtyard overlooking the bay I felt I could stay there forever. One can watch the harbor from above. Too cool for the pool during our visit but I am sure it is great in the summertime.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We took the "lift" down to the water. What a thrill..it brings you down from high on the cliff to the water's edge..
reviews.title: Loved the Grand Hotel Royal

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Rooms were spotless. Interesting blue and white tile on floors..I felt like I had arrived in Italy.
reviews.title: Bring back last year's chef

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location was just a short walk to the shops and restuarants but nice and quiet.
reviews.title: Pleasant Hotel - Great Views - Excellent Location - Very Good Staff

likes.liked: — Comfortable bedrooms with amazing sea views!
likes.disliked: — Lounge, restaurant and reception very old fashioned. Pool and sundeck poor.

reviews.title: Just okay
reviews.text: The front desk was friendly and helpful.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We recently stayed at this hotel for a business incentive trip. Sorrento is a beautiful city poised on the magical Almalfi Coast of Italy.
reviews.title: What a magical town!

likes.disliked: — no bathrobes, no evening turn down service

reviews.title: Beautiful Location
reviews.text: The hotel is centrally located to the main Piazza of Sorrento. Our room was on the 6th floor overlooking the gardens and the Bay of Naples. The furniture was the beautiful inlaid marquetry wood of the area and the bed was comfortable but not luxurious. The bathroom had a weird layout with the toilet behind the door, but the shower worked well and there were double sinks. There were no hand towels or washcloths, just linen towels which I thought were too nice to wash your face with. There were also no bathrobes and the toiletries weren't nice. If it is important to know, there was no evening turn down service.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007
reviews.text: The included breakfast was excellent with delicious food and many options! The bar had limited drink selections.
reviews.title: very nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lobby area was nice and for a modest fee there was an internet connection at a computer station.
reviews.title: Absolutely Wonderful Hotel
This hotel has it all!
reviews.text: Service was good.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Grand Royal in Sorrento was marvelous. The rooms were were very stylish, with the floors and walls done in distinctive Italian tiles. The room was of sufficient size for two and the bathroom was terrific (for us Americans who worship that sort of thing). Two sinks in two rooms, one for each of us and plenty of space to lay our our stuff. Nice tub and shower. The grounds were gorgeous, well maintained gardens with a gorgeous view of the Bay of Naples. The eating areas and bar areas were numerous, ample and accorded glorious views. The staff was first rate - courteous, quick and efficient. The continental breakfasts were a veritable feast. The walk to the town center was 5-10 minutes. .We stayed 9 days visiting various sites along the Amalfi coast - Capri, Positano and Pompeii. The hotel only added to our enjoyment of Sorrento, a lovely town with very friendly people.
reviews.title: FIRST CLASS HOTEL

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An enjoyable's week stay at the end of April. The staff were helpful and friendly, decor in the public areas, tasteful and the gardens well tended and attractive. The hotel is well situated, being only five minutes walk from the centre of Sorrento and overlooking the marina. The views across the bay of Naples to Vesuvius were wonderful. The road view room actually overlooked a lemon and orange grove and traffic noise was not an issue as the shutters provided excellent soundproofing. Pity the same couldn't have been said of the noisy residents of the room above who had a habit of dragging chairs noisily across the floor when we were dropping off to sleep!
reviews.title: Relaxing stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The negatives - and there were a few wee niggles! Wish we could have booked bed and breakfast rather than half board. The table d'hote meaus read well but unfortunately didn't deliver on quality and taste. Fish was invariably overcooked and the desserts, whilst looking spectacular were a real disappointment. I would have liked my lemon parfait to have had a hint of the fruit at the very least. After the third night we ate out. I suspect the half board is intended to keep you in the hotel and encourage drink sales which are very profitable (4euros for a small bottle of water and 20 euros on average for a bottle of wine). Breakfasts were better although you had to time it right to grab the fresh pineapple and melon. Sparkling wine didn't appear until the last day and the "omelette" chef was only on duty on 2 days.
reviews.title: The perfect hotel in Sorrento

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The sunloungers around the pool were very close together but at least there were no issues with towels at dawn. The pool was unheated and therefore pretty empty as only the hardiest souls ventured further than a toe dipping.
reviews.title: beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall, we enjoyed the break but would probably not return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Absolutely Amazing!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2005, traveled with family
reviews.text: This was our (my husband & I's) second visit to the Hotel Royal, we enjoyed our stay so much previously that no other hotel would do for us.
reviews.title: Great Hotel with fantastic views
Grand Hotel Royal - Wonderful
reviews.text: The view of the Bay of Naples and Vesuvius from the Hotel sea view room balcony is truly awe inspiring.

reviews.title: Fabulous, Romantic Location
reviews.text: Our room was even better this visit, a very spacious large double bedroom with double doors to the balcony from which we could wake to the view of the bay every morning.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was served a room overlooking the garden and the staff were excellent, there was even a chef cooking omlettes, pancakes etc at your request.
reviews.title: Amore!

likes.disliked: — Take the sightseeing bus around the peninsular - 15 euros for 2 hours

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Hotel staff were extremely friendly and helpful, and last year at our request arranged a day excursion to Pompeii. We were collected and returned by coach a hundred yards away from the Hotel and the guide was a colourful local lady named Matilda who made the whole day fun.
reviews.title: Bellissima!

description: This elegant and refined superior four-star hotel in the heart of the city of Sorrento is situated on a cliff top above the sea, overlooking the Gulf of Naples and Mount Vesuvius, and set within a large, historic park with an assortment of exotic plants, marvellous camellias and orange and lemon trees.
